body.p: In a 2003 study by Bertrand and Mullainathan to measure racial discrimination in the labor market, experimenters sent fictitious resumes to help-wanted ads in Boston and Chicago newspapers. To manipulate perception of race each resume was assigned either a very African American–sounding name or a very White sounding name. They then measured the response to the resumes. Which of the following is a correct statement about this study?
Bertrand, M., and Mullainathan, S. “Are Emily and Greg More Employable than Lakisha and Jamal?” Working Paper 9873, National Bureau of Economic Research, 2003. http://www.nber.org/papers/w9873.pdf

input.choice: It was a blind study because those who received the resumes did not know the treatment they received.
It was not a blind study because there was no placebo.
It was not a blind study because the experimenters knew where they were sending the resumes.
It was problematic because the subjects didn’t even know they were in an experiment.

response.feedback: Correct. Blind studies are those in which the subjects (in this case, the people who reviewed the resumes) do not know which treatment they receive.
Incorrect. While you are correct that there is no placebo, for an experiment or study to be considered blind, the subjects don’t know which treatment they are receiving. A placebo is not required.

Incorrect. While the experimenters may or may not have known whom they were studying, for an experiment or study to be considered blind the subjects don’t know which treatment they are receiving. A double-blind experiment is one in which the subjects don’t know which treatment they are receiving and neither do the people who are administering the treatment.

Incorrect. The fact that subjects did not know they were in an experiment in fact may help add realism to the study. Blind studies are those in which the subjects (in this case the people who reviewed the resumes) do not know which treatment they receive.

body.p: In a recent study to establish the effectiveness of a new cancer drug, subjects were randomly divided into three groups. Group A got a known and effective cancer drug, group B got the new experimental compound, and group C got a combination of the two drugs. None of the individuals nor the nurses knew group assignments, and nurses administering the drugs did not know what drug was being administered to their patients.
Which of the following is a correct statement about this study?

input.choice: It was a blind study because subjects did not know the treatment they were receiving.
It was not a blind study because there was no placebo.
It was a double-blind study because neither the subject nor the experimenter knew what the treatment for a patient was.
It was not a blind study because patients knew they were participating in a study.

response.feedback: Incorrect. While it is true that subjects did not know which treatment they were receiving, there is a better answer. Note that the experimenters did not know what treatment was being administered either which makes this a double-blind study.

Incorrect. In fact knowingly treating a cancer patient with an ineffective drug such as a placebo would be considered unethical. Placebos are not necessary for blind or double-blind studies, only that the subject (and for double-blind the experimenters) do not know which treatment is being received.
Correct. Neither the subjects nor the experimenters knew what treatment was being administered.

Incorrect. Whether or not the subjects know they are in an experiment does not necessarily affect whether or not it is blind or double-blind experiment. In this study neither the subjects nor the experimenters knew what treatment was being administered.
